Posts.Content:
Hi DSB
I can imagine how worried and concerned you must be right now, I think I would probably be thinking along the same lines if I also had family history like you do. But I think you will have a tough time finding a surgeon who will do a double mastectomy, I could be wrong of course but I think it is a big ask.
The only thing you can do is plead your case to the surgeon and see what he says, I think you should be guided by his advice. I hope whichever way it turns out, that you are happy and well at the end result. I wish you all the luck in the world and that God will look after you and guide you during this most testing and worrying time for you.
God bless.
Posts.Title: Needle biopsy

Posts.Content:
Hi Bev
Congrats on your 30 years of wedded bliss! Pleased to hear your hubby is doing well and you are both celebrating.
Posts.Title: A bit of clutter...

Posts.Content:
Hey Jordans
I think you should get it checked out, just to allay your fears if for nothing else. I recently had terrible pain in my right breast on and off for about
 3 weeks and I had an ultrasound and it was clear, nothing to worry about
. I was concerned because I have already had a mastectory on my left side so you can imagine how relieved I was when I got the results of the ultrasound. So I am urging you to go and have it checked out. 
Good luck I hope you get the same result I did.
Posts.Title: pain on breast?

Posts.Content:
Hi Jo
Sorry, when I read my post again, I meant to say left mastectomy, just put it down to old age I guess. lol.
Posts.Title: Loop incision surgery and radiation therapy

Posts.Content:
Dear GMA
My deepest sympathy to you and Carolyn's family. 
May God bless you.
Posts.Title: My daughter Carolyn

Posts.Content:
Hi Alcie
I am sorry you had to go through the radiation, I can only imagine how terrible it must have been. Good on you for being fanatical (although I don't think you are), where your health is concerned, if you're not fanatical about
 it then no-one else is either.
Personally, I was one of the lucky ones who did not need radiation or chemo afterwards as my cancer had not travelled but the lump had been in my breast for 6 years so I was told, however they did take my lymph nodes under the arm but like I said I am one of the more lucky ones and I thank God everyday for that. On Thursday this week, I am going for my 10 year examination - I can hardly believe it has been that long as I still remember the day the doctor found it.
I hope you stay well Alcie and keep being fanatical.
Kind regards
Jocelyn
Posts.Title: CNN: No radiation after surgery OK for some patients.

Posts.Content:
Hey KAB
I agree totally with LdyJane, go and see your doctor and he can arrange all that for you. Only a doctor would be able to tell you what it is. I would ask also for an ultrasound to be done. 
Good luck with it all, I hope it all turns out to be nothing to worry about
. Please let us know how you get on.
Posts.Title: Worried!

Posts.Content:
Hi Jo
I am also in Australia. In 2000 I had a lump, had the biopsy and it was cancerous, I had a left mammogram but did not need to have radiation or chemo because they had got all of the residual cancer and also took the lymph nodes under the arm. The surgeon told me the lump had been there for 6 years but luckily for me it had not travelled. I have not had any further problems and have just reached my 10 year anniversay.
I wish your mother all the best and I agree with her not to make her mind up yet and don't be bullied into it. Take the advice of the surgeon and be guided by what he says.
I hope your mother has a speedy recovery.
Posts.Title: Loop incision surgery and radiation therapy

Posts.Content:
Hi Siohban
Yes I am one of the really lucky ones who didn't have to have chemo or radiation but I did have to undergo a mastectomy. Thanks for your kind thoughts they are really appreciated.
Posts.Title: To Harrington 49...

Posts.Content:
Thank you Bev, I would love to join in on some discussions. Yes 10 years is a milestone isn't it, I have lost a couple of workfriends to breast cancer, I am certainly one of the lucky ones.
Thanks again for your kind words.
Jocelyn
Posts.Title: To Harrington 49...

Posts.Content:
Yes my daughter knew about
 this but it seems to have slipped her mind of late. Never mind, hopefully God will bring her back to me soon.
Thanks for your kind words.
Posts.Title: To Harrington 49...

Posts.Content:
Hi Roobles
I think it is probably the mammogram that has made your breast sore as that sometimes happens to me also. I know it is very concerning and worrying to be sent to the surgeon but it doesn't mean the worst. He will explain what they have found in laymans terms so you understand, and ask him as many questions as you can. It is a good idea to write down some questions before you go because when you get in there, if you are anything like me you will forget everything that was in your head.
Try not to worry too much, my thoughts and prayers are with you. After the surgeon's visit make sure you post to let us know how you got on. I'll be thinking of you.
Posts.Title: Mammogram trauma and findings?

Posts.Content:
Hi Warmheart
How did you go with the call back? I hope it wasn't bad news.
This is a great site for support so please keep posting and let us know how you are going?
Posts.Title: Call Back for 2nd mamogram

Posts.Content:
Hi Lori
I too am sorry for both you and your mother, how your lives have been turned upside down again by this insidious disease. I agree with Bev and of course you do as well that you should do whatever your mother wants, cook whatever she feels like and yes give her the treats she craves. I think quality of life is far more important.
I think you are a wonderful daughter for caring so much about
 your mother and I am sure she appreciates it every day even if she doesn't show it or tell you. Good luck to both of you and you are both in my prayers.
Posts.Title: Stage IV Breast Cancer

Posts.Content:
Hi Bev
I am sorry about
 your friend, it just seems that everyone has been either affected by this insidious disease or knows someone who has. I got really excited last week when I heard on the news that they had found a cure for breast cancer but it won't be available for 10 years. That is great news for future generations but what about
 all the ladies between now and then?
Congrats also on reaching 16 years, that is absolutely wonderful.
God bless.
Posts.Title: To Harrington 49...

Posts.Content:
Hi Alcie
My specialist came into my room and said I have excellent news for you, there was no residual cancer left. I asked him to speak in layman's terms and he said you will not have to have chemo or rads as there is nothing left. But he did say the cancer had been there for 6 years but had not travelled.
In Australia they don't send you for it if they think it isn't necessary and like I said tomorrow I am going for my 10 year check up.
Posts.Title: CNN: No radiation after surgery OK for some patients.

Posts.Content: Hi to you all, I am Jocelyn, diagnosed March 2000, left mastectomy, lymph nodes taken, no further treatment required just Tamoxifen for 5 years and now Femara forever. I thank God every day for my life and for sparing me the torture that so many of you ladies have suffered with chemo and radiation. I live 4 hours north of Sydney, Australia and I am now 56 years of age. Good luck to you all.
Posts.Title: ROLL CALL name, age, state and any other info to share
